page.title: 17The Village Hall.
page.content: One of the most imprtant buldings in the village of Upper Dicker is the Village Hall for it is used as ameeting place by various groups and many functions are held there. The Drama Group, which consists mainly of villagers, is responsible for producing a play in the summer, a cabaret in the autumn and a pantomime at Christmas. Several discos are held during the year, organised either by the villagers or by the local schools for there is very little entertainment for schoolchildren and teenagers within the area. Bonfire Night and Christmas parties are also held, as well as Keep Fit classes, Parish Council meetings, jumble sales, an annual auction and a local quiz called the Egg-head Competition. The adjoining field is used for football matches and Carnival
